result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon E. Jagodzinski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:36 a.m. Defendant Brandon E. Jagodzinski in court with attorney Haleverson for Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CM302 and 15CT138.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. 15CT138 OAR 2nd: 20 days jail, Provide DNA Sample, $200 fine + costs which includes DNA surcharge.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CT138 No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CT138.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 15CM302 is Dismissed and Read In

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halver concurs with joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT:***
15CT138 OAR 2nd: 
20 days jail, may be served the entire amount on electronic monitor, if eligible, and huber. Report today to get start date. To be served within 60 days.
Provide DNA Sample
$200 fine + costs which includes DNA surcharge, Pay within 60 days or set up payment plan

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Attorney Anne Renc in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court asks if there is an authorization.  
Atty Renc states there may be some confusion as to court time.
ADA wishes to proceed with the matter.
Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
NG plea to both charges.
PTC at 10:30  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
